title: Wednesday evening news briefing: Greatest obstacle to a Brexit deal
text:

DUP demand for veto over Brexit deal brings talks to standstill

A Brexit deal hangs in the balance. With talks intensifying and deadlines slipping, major issues remain unresolved on the final day before Boris Johnson seeks sign-off during a key EU summit starting tomorrow. Follow live updates here. The Prime Minister needs a deal approved by EU leaders if he is to avoid an almighty clash over asking for a delay to the UK's departure. But Brexit Secretary Stephen Barclay confirmed today that Mr Johnson will write a letter asking for an Article 50 extension if no deal is in place by Saturday - something the PM has repeatedly ruled out. The DUP appears the greatest obstacle between Mr Johnson and a Brexit deal. The Telegraph understands the party has signed up to the new customs proposals, but is now wrestling with demands for a veto. James Rothwell looks at the sticking points - and where there might be flexibility. And here is how the pound has swung today.

How are the latest twists of the Brexit saga being received in European capitals? Brussels Correspondent James Crisp writes that Brexit is viewed as a "contagious disease" that risks infecting the bloc. Henry Samuel reports from Paris that "bad cop" Emmanuel Macron could be Mr Johnson's unlikely ally. And Ireland Correspondent John Walsh believes Leo Varadkar is staking his political future on protecting Irish red lines - so will stand firm more than ever.
